title: Eden peace-themed website with guestbook

requirements.text: Create a responsive single-page website for a place named “Eden” that communicates the idea that Eden brings peace to the whole earth, with clear sections and polished English copy.

quotes: Make a website about a place named eden that brings peace to the whole earth

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders without errors on desktop and mobile widths
Page contains, at minimum: a hero section, an “About Eden” section, a “How Eden Brings Peace” section, and a footer
All user-facing text is in English and consistently references Eden’s peace mission

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme appropriate for a peaceful Eden concept (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styling) and use it consistently across the site (avoid default/plain styling).

quotes: Make a website about a place named eden that brings peace to the whole earth

acceptanceCriteria: Theme is applied consistently across all sections (headings, body text, buttons/links, cards)
Color palette and typography communicate a calm/peaceful aesthetic and are readable with sufficient contrast
Layout uses consistent spacing and a clear visual hierarchy

requirements.text: Add a “Messages of Peace” guestbook section that lets visitors submit a short message (name optional) and view the latest messages.

quotes: Make a website about a place named eden that brings peace to the whole earth

acceptanceCriteria: Frontend includes a form with validation (non-empty message; reasonable max lengths) and a list of submitted entries
Backend stores guestbook entries persistently and returns them in reverse-chronological order
Submitting a message updates the list in the UI without a full page refresh

requirements.text: Implement a Motoko backend API for the guestbook with methods to add an entry and list entries, including timestamps.

quotes: Make a website about a place named eden that brings peace to the whole earth

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a method to create a guestbook entry with fields: message, optional name, timestamp
Backend exposes a query method to list recent entries with a stable, serializable type
Data persists across canister upgrades (add migration only if required by state changes)

requirements.text: Add the required generated images as static assets and use them in the UI (hero background/illustration and a simple Eden mark).

quotes: Make a website about a place named eden that brings peace to the whole earth

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend
Hero section displays the hero image appropriately (responsive sizing, no distortion)
Site displays the Eden mark/logo in the header and/or footer

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text
Respect the single-actor Motoko backend architecture (all logic in backend/main.mo)
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths (compose components instead)
Do not add third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is allowed (not required for this build)
Do not use external databases or non-Motoko backend services
nonGoals: Email sending or external contact integrations

required: Serene Eden valley landscape with soft light, gentle river, distant mountains, calm atmosphere (eden-hero.dim_1920x1080.png)
Minimal circular Eden emblem with a simple leaf/dove motif, flat style (eden-mark.dim_512x512.png)
